pages.title: The Mother's Warning
pages.text:
Little Red Riding Hood lived with her mother in a house next to the forest.
Her mother gave Little Red Riding Hood a basket with cake and juice. She said, "Please go to your grandma. She is sick. Don't stray from the path. Be careful!" Little Red Riding Hood said, "Yes, Mom!" and set off.

pages.title: Little Red Riding Hood Meets the Wolf
pages.text:
In the forest, Little Red Riding Hood met the wolf. The wolf said, "Where are you going?" Little Red Riding Hood said, "To my grandmother. She is sick."
The wolf said, "Where does she live?" Little Red Riding Hood said, "In the house behind the trees."
The wolf thought, "I want to be there first!" He ran quickly to the grandmother's house.

pages.title: The Wolf Eats Grandma
pages.text:
The wolf came to Grandma's house. He knocked on the door.
Grandma said, "Who's there?"
The wolf said, "It's Little Red Riding Hood."
Grandma opened the door. The wolf jumped on her and ate her up. Then he put on her glasses and her cap. He lay down in bed.

pages.title: Little Red Riding Hood Comes to the House
pages.text:
Little Red Riding Hood came and said, "Good day, Grandma." The wolf said in a soft voice, "Good day, my child."
Little Red Riding Hood was surprised. She said, "Grandma, why do you have such big eyes?" The wolf said, "So that I can see you better."
Little Red Riding Hood continued, "Why do you have such big teeth?" The wolf said, "So that I can eat!"
And then he ate Little Red Riding Hood too.

pages.title: The Hunter Finds the Wolf
pages.text:
A hunter was passing by the house. He heard loud snoring.
He went into the house and saw the wolf in bed with a big belly.
The hunter said, "The wolf has eaten Grandma!" He took his scissors and cut open the wolf's belly.
Little Red Riding Hood and Grandma came out. They were alive!

pages.title: The Celebration
pages.text:
Little Red Riding Hood, Grandma, and the hunter were happy. They drank juice and ate cake from the basket.
Little Red Riding Hood said, "Thank you, dear hunter!"
Grandma said, "You saved us."
Everyone laughed and celebrated. The bad wolf was gone, and everyone was happy again.
